public static DialogBox getDukeDialog(String text, Image img) {
* The main Class of the Skeltal package that runs the program.
* A GUI for Duke using FXML.
* Controller for MainWindow. Provides the layout for the other controls.
* Creates two dialog boxes, one echoing user input and the other containing Duke's reply and then appends them to
* the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.
* This class is a child of task that has the additional attribute of time,
* to allow the storing of deadlines.
* A constructor that initialises a Deadline object.
* @param description A semi-processed string from the parser which contains
*                The task and the time. e.g "Task /time".
* @throws SkeltalException If the time description is not found.
* A method that overrides the store() function in the Task parent class,
* to include the task type and time description of the Deadline object.
* @return A String representation of the deadline object that is readable by the loader.
/** Returns a String representation of the Deadline object, for printing purposes.
* @return A string representation of the Deadline object for printing.

* to allow the storing of an Event timing.
* A constructor that initialises a Event object.
* @param description A semi-processed string from the parser which contains
*                The task and the time. e.g "Task /time".
* @throws SkeltalException If the time description is not found.
* A method that overrides the store() function in the Task parent class,
* to include the task type and time description of the Event object.
* @return A String representation of the Event object that is readable by the loader.

* userInput should be in the form "command arg1 arg2".
* @param userInput A String of the userInput.
throw new SkeltalException("OOPS! The description of todo cannot be empty!");
reply += "Noted. I have removed this task\n";
throw new SkeltalException("OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");

* Represents the main class of the Skeltal chatbot app.

* A constructor to initialise a SkeltalException object.
* @param errorMessage A String representative of the error message that will be printed.

* @return An ArrayList of Tasks representative of the file.
reply = "No existing tasks can be found! Creating a new list for you :)";

* Writes the current list of tasks to the txt file at the specified filepath.
* @throws Exception If the file does not exist.
public static String store() throws SkeltalException {
* A constructor that initialises a Task object.
* A method to get the task description.
* Returns a String representation of the task that is suitable for loading.
* @return A loadable String representation of the Task object.
* Returns true if the task has been completed, else returns false.
* @return A boolean representation of whether the task has been completed.
* Sets the task to a completed state.
* Returns a String representation of the task suitable for printing.
* @return A String representation of the task.
private static ArrayList<Task> tasks = new ArrayList<>();
* A method to add a Task object into the list.
String reply = "Got it. I've added this task\n" +
"Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.";
* A method to list the Task objects currently in the list.
* Returns the index position of the task in the list.
* @return The index position of the task in the list.
* Sets the Task at the index (index_1 - 1) in the TaskList to a "completed" state.
* @param index_1 The index of the task in the list + 1.
reply += "Done! I've marked this task as done!\n";
* Deletes the Task at the index index in the TaskList.
* @param index The index of the task in the list.
reply += "Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.";
* A method to load tasks into the task list from an ArrayList object.
* @param arrayList An ArrayList object containing Task objects.
reply += "Here are the matching tasks in your list.";
* Returns a String that represents the loadable form of the TaskList.
* @return A String representation of the TaskList
* A constructor that initialises a To Do object.
* @param task The task that should be stored in the object.
* A method that overrides the store() function in the Task parent class,
* to include the task type of the object.
* @return A String representation of the object that is readable by the loader.
* Returns a String representation of the object, for printing purposes.
* @return A string representation of the object for printing.
* A class that handles interaction with the user, Eg printing responses.
"GREETINGS! You have been visited by the CS2103 skeleton who only appears once every 2147483647 years! \n" +
"Type /updoot in 2013 seconds or you will forever have bad bones :) \n" +
* Returns a boolean to the skeltal system to signal a shutdown.
* Prints a goodbye statement to the user.
* @return A boolean with a true value.
System.out.println("Thanks for chatting! Hope to see you again soon! ");
